meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry of pain or anger.
meanings.sent1: The waugh of the injured dog echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The waugh of the child startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The waugh of the baby made everyone rush to see what happened.
meanings.sent4: The waugh of the wind sounded like a ghostly wail in the night.
meanings.sent5: The waugh of the thunder shook the windows with its intensity.

meanings.definition: A deep, guttural sound made by a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion's waugh could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The waugh of the old man's cough was unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The waugh of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent4: The waugh of the bear sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The waugh of the bull warned of its impending charge.

meanings.definition: To utter a loud, harsh cry.
meanings.sent1: She waughed in pain when she stubbed her toe.
meanings.sent2: The crowd waughed in protest against the decision.
meanings.sent3: He waughed with joy when he won the game.
meanings.sent4: The warrior waughed a battle cry before charging into the fight.
meanings.sent5: The comedian waughed loudly, making the audience burst into laughter.
